intro: Sageretia latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive grayish-green color. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in the spring. Sageretia latifolia is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and along stream banks.
